radiographic_examinations.findings: Slight anterior pericardial thickening; no axillary, hilar, or mediastinal lymphadenopathy; no pulmonary parenchymal or pleural abnormality.
No evidence of deep venous thrombosis.
New development of a vague mass-like lesion, 3.2 cm in diameter, in the left lower lobe.

radiographic_examinations.date: Three days after the chest radiograph
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple peripheral opacities with patchy ground-glass appearance; ring-like opacity in the left lower lobe.

radiographic_examinations.date: Nine days after the previous CT scan
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple subpleural ground-glass and nodular opacities, essentially stable; large left lower lobe mass persisted but appeared less opaque.
Many nodules throughout the lungs decreased in size; ground-glass nodule in left lower lobe enlarged to 4.2 by 2.6 cm; new nodules of 2 and 4 mm in right lower lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Some nodules decreased in size while others enlarged.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple subpleural nodular opacities, a few resolved but majority increased in size; many new lesions.
Pulmonary nodules became less opaque and assumed a ground-glass appearance with some slight size increase.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Some nodules appeared to increase slightly in size.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous new irregular opacities throughout both lungs; larger opacity than previous examination in left lower lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: No lymphadenopathy or osseous lesions seen.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Pulmonary nodules showed regression of some and enlargement of others; slight pericardial thickening.
No evidence of cancer; organizing fibrin, reactive bronchial epithelial cells, histiocytes, lymphocytes present; no malignant cells found.
